'''''Cantharellus cascadensis''''' is a [[fungus]] native to the [[Pacific Northwest]] region of [[North America]]. It is a member of the genus ''[[Cantharellus]]'' along with other popular edible [[chanterelle]]s.  It is named after the [[Cascade Range]], where it was formally described in 2003.<ref name=dun03/>

==Similar species==
Several other species of chanterelle may be found in western North America:
*''[[Cantharellus californicus|C. californicus]]''
*''[[Cantharellus roseocanus|C. roseocanus]]''
*''[[Cantharellus formosus|C. formosus]]''
*''[[Cantharellus subalbidus|C. subalbidus]]''

Additionally, ''[[Hygrophoropsis aurantiaca]]'', ''[[Chroogomphus|Chroogomphus tomentosus]]'', and species in the genera ''[[Craterellus]]'', ''[[Gomphus (fungus)|Gomphus]]'', ''[[Omphalotus]]'', and ''[[Polyozellus]]'' may have a somewhat similar appearance to ''C. cascadensis''.
